channel.title: The Dr. Drew Podcast
channel.description: Dr. Drew Pinsky, board certified internist and addiction medicine specialist, takes listener calls and talks to experts on a variety of topics relating to health, relationships, sex and drug addiction.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Dr. Drew Pinsky, board certified internist and addiction medicine specialist, takes listener calls and talks to experts on a variety of topics relating to health, relationships, sex and drug addiction.
channel.itunes:summary: Dr. Drew Pinsky, board certified internist and addiction medicine specialist, takes listener calls and talks to experts on a variety of topics relating to health, relationships, sex and drug addiction.

item.title: #329: Bertha Madras
item.description: Psychobiology expert and former Deputy Director of Demand Reduction in the White House Office of National Drug Control Policy Bertha Madras joins Dr. Drew today for a conversation about drug use in America and how the medical community is focusing its efforts to try and better understand the way that our brains interact with drugs, especially when it comes to the opioid crisis in America.
item.content:encoded: Psychobiology expert and former Deputy Director of Demand Reduction in the White House Office of National Drug Control Policy Bertha Madras joins Dr. Drew today for a conversation about drug use in America and how the medical community is focusing its efforts to try and better understand the way that our brains interact with drugs, especially when it comes to the opioid crisis in America.

item.title: #328: Jessica Lahey
item.description: Teacher, writer & mother Jessica Lahey join's Dr. Drew to talk about her New York Times bestselling book, The Gift of Failure: How the Best Parents Learn to Let Go So Their Children Can Succeed. Jessica and Drew do a deep dive on Jessica's history working the fields of education and drug treatment as well as her career as an author and her upcoming book on how to raise our next generation as more addiction resistant.
item.content:encoded: Teacher, writer & mother Jessica Lahey join's Dr. Drew to talk about her New York Times bestselling book, The Gift of Failure: How the Best Parents Learn to Let Go So Their Children Can Succeed. item.title: #327: Phone Calls
item.description: Dr. Drew is joined by you, the listeners this week on The Dr. Drew Podcast as Drew turns to the phones and speaks to callers with a wide variety of questions ranging from a question about a-sexuality to testosterone supplementation and everything in between.

item.title: #326: Phillip Stutts
item.description: Author and political marketing expert Phillip Stutts joins Dr. Drew for a long form podcast about both Phillip's work in the space of digital marketing and disruption as well as a deep dive on the Esophageal Achalasia that Phillip has been battling for years and trying to find his own path to a cure. Drew and Phillip also talk about how Phillip has brought his experience in business disruption to his approach to disrupting the medical community in an effort to find a cure for his disease.
item.content:encoded: Author and political marketing expert Phillip Stutts joins Dr. Drew for a long form podcast about both Phillip's work in the space of digital marketing and disruption as well as a deep dive on the Esophageal Achalasia that Phillip has been battling for years and trying to find his own path to a cure. Drew and Phillip also talk about how Phillip has brought his experience in business disruption to his approach to disrupting the medical community in an effort to find a cure for his disease.

item.title: #325: Ruthie Lindsey
item.description: Dr. Drew welcomes Ruthie Lindsey for a podcast exploring her very interesting life story including an exceptionally traumatic incident in her teenage years as a result of a car accident wherein she was broadsided at speed by an ambulance. Ruthie's crazy story doesn't end there, and she and Drew do their best to examine her entire journey and how she was able to persevere and find a way back to living a rich and fulfilling life.
item.content:encoded: Dr. Drew welcomes Ruthie Lindsey for a podcast exploring her very interesting life story including an exceptionally traumatic incident in her teenage years as a result of a car accident wherein she was broadsided at speed by an ambulance. item.title: #324: Laurie Kilmartin
item.description: Dr. Drew welcomes comedian and writer Laurie Kilmartin to discuss her career writing on Conan, her childhood swimming coach's creepy behavior. her experiences as a mother and her new book 'Dead People Suck: A Guide for Survivors of the Newly Departed' which examines Laurie experience of losing a parent to lung cancer.
item.content:encoded: Dr. Drew welcomes comedian and writer Laurie Kilmartin to discuss her career writing on Conan, her childhood swimming coach's creepy behavior. her experiences as a mother and her new book 'Dead People Suck: A Guide for Survivors of the Newly Departed' which examines Laurie experience of losing a parent to lung cancer.

item.title: #323: Lilian Garcia
item.description: Former WWE diva and host Lilian Garcia joins Dr. Drew for a wide ranging conversation about her unconventional path and her time working with one of the worlds largest entertainment companies

item.title: #322: Ryan Holiday
item.description: Fan-favorite Ryan Holiday returns to the podcast to talk about his newest book, Conspiracy, and the interesting connection between Peter Thiel, Hulk Hogan, and the downfall of Gawker.
